column1: some shape into him but too straight and he can tuck it off his pads straightaway into square leg to get off the mark
in the channel outside off, left alone
gets it to nip away off the seam, and Rohit is not fully forward in defense, it takes a thick outside edge and rolls past gully
oooh that one reared up. Back of a length and moving away but continues rising as it passes Agarwal and goes at chest height almost
fullish around off, nudged off the front foot towards wide mid-on

beauty. Snaking past the outside edge, was so close to actually getting a nick. Slightly back of a length and moving away a touch, Agarwal comes on the front foot for a solid defensive shot but the ball whizzes past the bat
full angling in on off stump, defended with an angled bat towards point
shape away from the batsman but this is well outside off and he can leave it alone easily
fullish on off, defended towards cover on the front foot
shaping into Rohit but ends up on the pads and is comfortably tucked through midwicket for an easy three
angles it into him from slightly wide of the crease and moves it away after pitching, but it was on the sixth stump and Agarwal leaves it well alone
not getting his line right, though he's getting a lot of movement away. But well outside off and he isn't going to play at that
lovely beats the outside edge again with another one that moves off the seam and snakes past the bat even as the batsman is coming on the front foot to defend
this time it's too far outside off and Rohit is not going to go anywhere near that
strays on the pads that time and is clipped to fine leg
good length nibbling around off stump and defended from the crease with soft hands
nips this back into Rohit now who gets a thick inside edge off his forward defensive onto pad. Didn't account for the inwards movement, but fortunately for Rohit, got some bat on it
mixes it up by bowling this back of a length on the fourth stump line. Rohit tucks his bat well behind him to let it pass through
angling in on a fifth stump line and moving away
fuller on off, defended to gully
streaky. Back of a length outside off and Agarwal ended up fending it off almost, following it with his hands. It flies off the shoulder of the bat, between third slip and gully
back of a length on off, punched to extra cover. He's over-stepped so it's a no-ball.
full, swinging into him, defended on middle stump
swinging into him again but very full and pushed back to the bowler
on a hard length outside off, left alone
length outside off, left alone
he's getting wobble in the air is Philander and bowling it on a fourth stump channel. A slightly brave call to let it go, especially given Philander's ability to seam it in
and Philander has brought this one back in, perhaps influenced by Rohit's leaving of the previous ball. But this one is a bit too straight and it runs down to fine leg off a thickish inside edge

huge appeal and they've gone for a review. Corker of a ball and it almost seemed like Agarwal was going to walk off, but stopped. It's an lbw appeal. Pitches on a length and seams in past his bat, flicks his pad and goes through. he's going to be saved by umpire's call. Impact and hitting the stumps are both umpire's call, so South Africa won't lose their review. But close one for Agarwal
length outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, left alone again
gets that to bounce up from a length above waist and Rohit has to awkwardly squirt it into the offside
length on off, defended carefully towards point
full on off, bit of movement into him again, solidly defended on the front foot
super from Rabada, left him just feeling for the ball with feet rooted. Nips away off the seam and Rohit tries to drive it without moving his feet at all and it whistles past the outside edge
and caught in two minds now whether to play or leave. Makes as if to push at it, length outside off and then tries to take his bat away. Gets a bottom edge that rolls to slips

takes on the short ball but doesn't connect well. The pull shot loops into the air but is going to land well short of deep square. Made contact off the end of the bat, which was fortunate because if he had connected, he could have been caught
length outside off, left alone
back of a length outside off, getting it to move in the air and off the pitch, but well outside off so can be left alone
length well outside off, he takes a big stride out to cover the line and lets it go
full outside off, takes a big stride out to defend it back to the bowler
back of a length outside off, left alone
and again Philander shows he can move the ball both ways, bringing this back in. Rohit was trying to nudge it into the legside but it defeats bat and hits him on the thigh pad
digs it in short outside off and Agarwal stays back to pat it down
and banged in back of a length again, Agarwal steers it to gully. Wasn't in control of that shot and quite out of position while playing it, with bat far from the body
back of a length outside off, moving away, left alone
strays on the pads that time and it rolls to fine leg
another one that beats bat. Back of a length and nice carry on that, moving away, but it's short enough that it doesn't threaten the batsman's wicket, though it would have made him uncertain
and this one squirts off the outside edge off a half-forward prod and goes once again between third slip and gully! Second time that's happened in this first 35 minutes of play
starts off with a back of a length ball that jags into the batsman, who defends from close to his body near his midriff
short and wide outside off, he went for it and slashed hard, but straight to point

between keeper and first slip! Short outside off again and he goes for the forceful cut off the back foot, but gets a toe end that dies on the keeper as it goes to his right. He dives and gets a glove on it, but can't hold on
148.5 kph. Good length nipping in sharply and brave leave from Agarwal. that was a quick one
fuller on the stumps, Agarwal keeps bat close to pad while going on the front foot and opening the face to guide it to point
fullish and coming into him now at 147.1 kph, he defends from the crease
good length outside off, well judged leave
strays too far down leg and it's too far for Rohit to connect with the flick
beaten outside off, but what Rohit did well there was not follow the ball. Back of a length and nipping away and he stayed close to pad, inside the line as the ball whizzed past
length ball on the pads, clipped to backward of square
too far down leg again and no contact with bat

corker of a ball gets the breakthrough. Banged it in on a hard length again, but this time the line was perfect, on middle and off stump. Moved away too, or rather straightened after pitching, and it was too close to the batsman for Rohit to not play at it, ends up getting an outside edge with the ball going past his midriff. De Kock does the rest.
back of a length and zips through outside off. Left alone
back of a length outside off, left alone
length on off, defended from the crease. Feet not moving much for Agarwal for those

ducks into the bouncer and gets pinged on the helmet. Excellently directed short ball and Agarwal didn't duck quickly enough, and cops a blow that flies off the helmet to the fine leg boundary. He wasn't in a good position to play the short ball, and didn't seem to have read the bounce till it was too late
nice response by the batsman. Double bluff by Nortje, who bowls this full and outside off. It was 148 kph, but in the slot to drive and Agarwal executes a perfect one, screaming through cover
back of a length again but well outside off, left alone
good length outside off and defended carefully from the crease. Rabada's over-stepped again though, for his second no-ball of this innings
good length still on that probing line outside off, Pujara steers it towards gully
pulls the length back a bit but keeps the line outside off and nips this one into him, Pujara defends it back to the bowler from the back foot

put down but that is tough to call a drop. Too full on the pads and flicked firmly by Pujara. Bavuma is at short leg and the ball goes straight to him but he had very little time to react and is unable to hold on to it, it bounces to the ground off his chest
back of a length outside off, shoulders arms
length ball on the pads, flicks them and goes to short fine leg
another no-ball, second of the over and third in the first hour - all by Rabada.
fuller inducker, struck on the pads and there is a half appeal but that was probably going down leg
back of a length on the pads, flicked again, doesn't carry to Bavuma at short leg this time but he fields it
length ball nipping in, defended solidly on the front foot
excellent line, probing on off with subtle movement, but well dealt with by Pujara who stays inside the line and defends with an angled bat towards cover point
digs it in shorter this time and Pujara pushes it to extra cover off the back foot
keeps to that in the channel line, 146.1 kph that time and not even the quickest ball of the over, there was one touching 147 earlier. Pujara defends
full outside off and jagging in, but Pujara covers the line and leaves it well alone
length ball but around fifth stump and moves away after landing, Agarwal shoulders arms
length ball, much closer to the stumps this time, around fourth stump, defended with soft hands off the back foot
length again, in the channel, Agarwal looked a bit unsure whether to play or leave, defends tentatively towards cover-point in the end
a touch fuller outside off, a big stride forward and a solid defence
fuller in the corridor once more, Agarwal comes forward before leaving it alone
length ball around off, Agarwal looks to defend from the back foot, the ball hits the inner half and rolls towards square leg
too full around off, Agarwal takes half a step forward and presents the full face of the bat, a little bit of punch as well and the ball races along the carpet to the long-off boundary
another gorgeous drive. Over-pitched once more, just outside off and Agarwal digs it out through covers by opening the face of the bat
147.5kph, pulls back his length a bit this time, just around the fourth stump, defended from the back foot
short of length around off, Agarwal hops in his crease and drops it at his feet
too full once again and that's third boundary of the over. Just outside off, and Agarwal once again concentrating on placement and timing, a drive through extra cover this time
length ball around off and middle, Agarwal goes back and defends it with a straight bat
gets off the mark on his 13th ball, a length ball around off and middle and nipping back in, tucked away behind square leg
length ball outside off, in that corridor of uncertainty, Agarwal wasn't sure to go back or forward, ton play or leave, almost gets squared up as he pushes it towards cover-point
length ball around off, a big stride forward and defends it with bat and pad close
a touch fuller outside off, once again a good front-foot stride, defends it towards cover
length outside off, comes forward before letting it go away, comes back in after landing but well away from the off stump
length outside off, that's the zone Agarwal has looked a bit uncomfortable in, pushes it towards point and then rehearses his shot
short of length outside off, whizzes past Pujara who drops his wrists to stay out of the line
goes for the yorker this time, around the off stump, but doesn't nail it exactly, Pujara jams his bat at it
short of length at the batsman this time, Pujara stays back and defends it on the leg side
length ball in the corridor, Pujara comes forward, watches the ball closely before letting it go through
fuller outside off, Pujara comes forward and pushes it through covers, comes back for the third
146.3kph, length outside off, stays beside the line of the ball and punches it through cover, seventh four in his 30 runs
length ball around off, around 124kph. Looked like a legcutter, Pujara had enough time to adjust and defend it on the off side
length ball around off, Pujara takes half a step forward and defends it right under his eyes
length ball on middle and leg, tucked away towards square leg
length in the corridor, 127kph. Moving away after landing, Agarwal lets that go through to the keeper

fuller around off, Agarwal, who is already standing out his crease, comes forward and drives it towards the bowler, Philander fields it in his follow through and has a shy at the stumps. No direct hit but Agarwal was quick to get back in his crease
length outside off, and once again that squared-up defence from Agarwal towards cover-point
fuller on the stumps, drives it towards mid-on but Rabada has overstepped once again, his fourth of the morning
length ball angling on to the pads, flicked behind square leg
length ball around off, defended from the crease towards cover
length ball outside off, comes forward and defends again
short this time, well-directed too, angling towards the rib cage, Agarwal hops in his crease and dabs it on the leg side
short again, just outside off this time, Agarwal once again jumps and drops it on the off side with soft hands
another short one, angling down the leg side though, Agarwal manages to stay away from the line of the ball. Good take by de Kock behind the stumps
fuller around off, Pujara comes forward and defends
length ball on the stumps, defended again from the front foot
length again, uses his feet this time, comes forward and blocks
skips down once again, reaches to the pitch of the ball and whips it towards midwicket, Rabada with the chase, puts in the slide but cannot prevent the boundary
sashays down the ground once more and flicks to the right of mid-on this time, the ball teases the fielder all the way before kissing the boundary line
length ball on the stumps, angling in on the pads, defended from the front foot
short of length around off, once again gets the batsman hopping, who dabs it on the leg side, Rabada slips in his follow through but all well
length ball around off, defended solidly towards covers
length ball around off, defended from the crease towards covers once again
short of length outside off, Agarwal was surprised a bit as he wasn't perhaps expecting it to bounce much. Does well to defend it with soft hands on the off side
a proper bouncer this time at the batsman, Agarwal is up to it and ducks under comfortably
length, around fifth stump, Agarwal was rooted to his crease, looks to defend it with his hands and gets beaten as the ball moves away after pitching
length ball around off, stays in the crease and blocks
fuller on the stumps, reaches to the pitch and flicks towards midwicket, a diving stop by Nortje keeps it to one
length ball at the stumps, backs away and punches it towards covers
length ball around off, angling in, Agarwal pushes it towards cover-point
length ball around off, defended from the back foot
flighted on off, comes forward and drives it towards long-on
short of length around off and middle, defended from the back foot
short of length outside off, once again one of those squared-up defensive dabs towards cover-point
length ball around off, stays beside the line and defends
length ball outside off, comes forward and pushes it towards covers, the fielder lets it go through his hands, Muthusamy there. Agarwal gets three
length ball, around fifth stump, Pujara comes forward before shouldering arms
short of length outside off, Pujara drops his hands to let it go through
length ball around off, defended from the crease towards the off side
length ball angling, Agarwal was stuck in his crease, gets an inside edge on to the pads as he looks to defend
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
length outside off, stays back and punches it back towards the bowler
fuller around off, leans into it and defends almost smelling it, as coaches would say
length outside off, chops it towards short third man from the back foot
a snorter. Short of length outside off, Pujara was looking to defend first but sways away at the last moment, keeping his gloves out
short of length outside off, shouldered arms this time
length ball around middle and leg and flicked away through midwicket, the mid-on fielder chasing it but it keeps running away from him, fifty partnership also comes up with that boundary
length ball in the corridor, left alone this time
length ball around off and angling in, stays back and defends it towards square leg
an outside edge but into the ground towards gully. Was a length ball around fourth stump, Pujara was looking to defend but it moves a bit away and takes the outside edge
full on off, and he lunges out to defend with the full face of the bat
drags it down short but Agarwal doesn't try to hit it too hard, just strokes a cut to cover
strays on the pads and he's again taken a big stride but works it very fine
good length, comes nicely forward and covers the line - on middle - to defend solidly
fuller and defended on the front foot
speared in on the stumps and he goes deep into his crease that time and blocks it out
back of a length in the channel, safely left alone
died on the keeper a bit there, slightly back of a length outside off again, and he shoulders arms
length in the channel and moving away, Pujara reads it well and covers the line while shouldering arms
fuller, keeping it on that probing line but Pujara is assured in his front foot defence
back of a length shaping away from the batsman but outside off and Pujara is not interested in getting bat anywhere near it
length on off and defended solidly on the front foot
big stride forward and makes room but the ball is to straight to drive inside out and he pushes it back to the bowler
defended on the front foot
back of a length, some extra bounce on that and he makes a quick adjustment to punch softly to cover

too full, ends up in the slot and Agarwal was looking for a release and he gets nicely to the pitch of the ball with a decisive front foot movement and uses his wrists to drive it straight back past the bowler
this is loose bowling, half-volley on the pads now and easily clipped of his pads through midwicket. Nice looking shot
expansive cover drive this time even though Maharaj manages to pull his length back a bit, but he can't beat the man at cover
length outside off, it's like he's bowling in a tunnel, but Pujara happy to defend those all day
and that's what Pujara will do to you with his patience. Philander errs in length, too short and Pujara rocks back to cut this fiercely through point
length on the fourth stump channel and he's back to shouldering arms
length nibbling at off stump again, defended from the crease
a little wider of off stump this time but still on that back of a length, and Pujara's not letting his bat near that one
on the shorter side but well outside off and almost dies on the keeper
fuller outside off, steered towards gully on the front foot
good length, drawing him forward but not to the pitch of the ball, but he blocks it
inside edge onto pad. A bit uncertain from Agarwal that time, he didn't come fully forward and gets a thick edge onto pad
stays back and square drives it to point
fuller, comes on the front foot to defend
well outside off and he shoulders arms to that
fuller, gets forward to block
wider outside off, Pujara lets it go
length in the channel, lets it go
full on the stumps now, making him play at it finally. Bit of wobble on that, flicked off his toes almost to mid-on
full on off, defended to the bowler
shaping away, very full on off, driven to extra cover
skipping down the track and the bowler saw him coming and dragged the length back, but Agarwal has enough room to punch to cover
full on the stumps, defended on the front foot
there's some turn! Good length, dips on him and rips past the bat while he's coming forward to defend
and this time there's extra bounce, Agarwal was getting down low to cut but it goes over his bat
slight hesitation in running but they make the single comfortably. The strike hadn't turned over for a fair bit. This was fuller but on leg stump and he nudged it gently towards mid-on
excellent shot, not that much wide or short but he cuts it from almost in front of the stumps and through backward point. Just needed a hint of space and he capitalised
full on the stumps, pushed firmly to mid-off
length on off, stays in his crease and defends
crisp cover drive on the front foot to a fuller one outside off, but the man at cover tumbles to his left to stop the ball. Parries it to extra cover
length on the stumps, moving away a touch, but he was well behind it and could defend fairly comfortably in the end
brings this one back in and he was coming forward to flick this, eventually works it to fine leg off a thick inside edge
back to Philander vs Pujara and it's back to the length ball in the corridor that the batsman defends
tossed up outside off, big stride out to defend
bit of extra bounce again, took off from a length, Agarwal was staying back to punch ends up popping it in the air briefly towards point, though it falls well short
fuller and defended on the front foot
terrific shot and a great way to raise yet another fifty for Mayank Agarwal. Dragged marginally short, and he didn't go hard to cut but such fantastic timing that it races through point
full on middle and off, comes on the front foot to defend
starts off with a pacy bouncer on target that Pujara is quickly forced to duck under
another bouncer and he ducks below it again, this one going over leg stump
full and straight this time, defended from the crease
length on off, tucked towards the leg gully

another short ball, this time outside off. There's a spot on the pitch there from which the ball doesn't rise much and this one doesn't either. Pujara's swaying out of the way anyway and not interested in playing it
sharp one back of a length on leg stump, somewhat awkwardly kept down
length outside off, defended towards gully
fuller, pushed to extra cover
good length drawing him into a big stride forward to defend
slightly fuller on the stumps, makes room to drive to extra cover
too short again and cuts it to point's right
flatter on a length on the stumps, punched to the bowler's right
bluffs and bowls a length ball but Agarwal goes on the back foot and tucks it to short leg's left and between midwicket and square leg for a single
and there's the bouncer now, homing in on Pujara's head but he spots it early and ducks safely under
back of a length on off this time and he stays in his crease and transfers weight back to defend to the bowler's right

digs it in again back of a length and Pujara stays still and in his crease, allows the ball to come on to him and defends from just above waist height with soft hands to take the sting out of the ball and drop it close to him

full ball, outside off and Pujara was waiting for it, drives it fluently through cover. Agarwal wanted a third and was coming back but was sent back by Pujara. De Kock gets the throw at his end and has a shy but misses. Now Pujara wants to run for the overthrow but Agarwal sends him back
length on the leg stump, pats it down
too full, given the room outside off to drive through cover, using his wrists to manoeuvre it through point
pulls the length back a bit, but he stays back and strokes it through cover off the back foot.
good length, draws him on the front foot to defend without quite getting to the pitch of the ball
fuller on the stumps, worked off his toes to square leg
good length outside off, smothered in defence on the front foot
too full and comes on the front foot to drive firmly to long-off
back of a length on the stumps, tucked to midwicket
and the first ball around the wicket is a bouncer which he ducks safely under
another short ball that rises up  to just below the shoulder but it's on leg stump and Agarwal had decided to go for it, gets it fine enough to go to the boundary. Well clear of leg gully
another short ball and he ducks under it again
bowls this one fuller, but its on the pads and is clipped comfortably to fine leg
back of a length on the stumps, tucked to leg gully - who has gone back wide for Pujara
good length outside off, front foot defence
good length on off, skids through a bit, he stayed back to this and jabs it into the offside
length around off again, defended on the front foot
good length, he's coming well forward to defend but this one wasn't full enough to get to the pitch of. Kept down nonetheless
fuller on off, driven to extra cover
fuller outside off again, goes for the punchy drive but can't go past extra cover
a short one to start after drinks. Pujara sways away and drops his hands as well
short of length around off, Pujara gets behind this and drops it near his feet
short of length, towards the rib cage this time, Pujara dabs it towards leg gully
short of length outside off, plays away from the body, pushes it towards cover-point for a quick single
another short one at the batsman, Mayank ducks under it
another short one, angling towards the batsman, Agarwal had no issues getting under it
length ball around off, a little bit of turn, Pujara waits in his crease before defending
length ball angling in towards the batsman, defended from the front foot
uses his feet this time and flicks it to the right of Nortje at square leg who makes a sliding stop
length ball outside off, comes forward and defends
skips down the wicket once again, but gets too close to the ball, pushes it towards short midwicket
use of feet and this time he finds the gap, whips it to the right of Nortje and finds the deep square leg boundary
short one and Agarwal brings out the pull this time, rolls his wrists over it, there's no deep-backward square leg and Agarwal gets four
short of length at the batsman, Agarwal hops in his crease and defends it with soft hands
pulled with disdain, short of length outside off, transfers the weight back, swivels and pulls it in front of square this time
another short one and another pull, not from the middle of the bat this time though, only a single
short of length outside off, punched off the back foot but the ball hits the inner half and dribbles towards the bowler
length ball but down the leg side, Pujara helps it towards fine leg
length ball around off, stays in the crease and taps it towards the off side
fuller on the stumps, whips it towards short midwicket

length ball outside off, punches it towards backward point where the fielder fumbles. They are going for a run after a bit of yes-no. du Plessis fields the deflection at covers and fires in the throw but Agarwal was in by then
length ball outside off, some extra bounce this time, hits the sticker of the bat as Agarwal defends it on the off side
length outside off, gets forward and slashes it towards deep extra cover
fuller on the stumps, turns it towards short leg
length ball around off, defended on the off side
short and wide, some extra bounce there, cuts it towards sweeper cover
fuller on the stumps, takes a step down the track and pushes it towards short midwicket
beaten! Coming in with the angle, pitching around middle and leg, gripping the surface. Pujara comes forward to defend and gets beaten by the turn
dragged short this time and Pujara doesn't miss out. Rocks back and pulls it over deep square leg, into the stands
length outside off, goes back and cuts it towards deep cover
fuller on the stumps, skips down and nudges it towards short midwicket
length ball on the stumps, defended from the front foot
skips down and turns it towards square-ish midwicket, was looking for a run but a loud no from Agarwal sends him back
use of feet once again, pushed towards short midwicket this time
woah! What happened there! Short of length outside off, Pujara was on the back foot but it bounces to surprises everyone. Luckily for Pujara it was away from him and bounces too much to evade the bat
length ball on the stumps, comes forward and blocks
length ball on the stumps, punched back towards the bowler
length outside off, opens the face of the bat to work it towards short third man
length ball on the stumps, flicked towards square leg
short of length, Agarwal rocks back and pulls it towards the vacant deep square leg area
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller on the stumps, leans forward and drives it towards long-off
skips down but cannot reach to the pitch, pads it away in the end
length outside off, goes for the cut, some extra bounce there. Agarwal does well to keep it down, finds short third man though
uses his feet but gets too close to the ball. Digs it out towards the bowler
short outside off, cuts it towards deep backward point
short of length outside off, cuts it towards square cover, straight towards the fielder
beaten outside off. Length ball around off and middle, Pujara comes forward, leans and looks to bock but the ball spins away
length ball outside off, punched towards extra cover from the crease
short of length outside off, defended from the back foot towards cover
length outside off, transfers his weight on the back foot and steers it towards cover-point
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it towards extra cover
goes for the yorker and almost nails it. At the stumps but Agarwal is quick enough to get his bat down, bunts it towards mid-on
short of length outside off, punched towards sweeper cover from the back foot and they came for the second
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and turns it behind square leg
length ball around middle and leg, comes forward and defends. The ball hits the outer half and rolls towards the off side
skips down to this length ball and whips to the left of short midwicket, finds the boundary
length ball around off, defended from the crease
that's fifty for Pujara. Short and wide outside off, goes back and cuts it past backward point for four more
length around off, comes down the track once again and looks to defend, the ball turns a little bit and rolls towards cover-point of the outer half
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it towards the bowler
length ball angling in towards the batsman, Agarwal stays in his crease and closes the face of the bat to work it towards midwicket
fuller around off, looks to defend without much feet movement. Gets an inside edge on to the pads
fuller on the stumps this time and flicked in front of square leg for a couple
length ball outside off, Pujara rises on his toes and punches it in front of point the point fielder

Rabada strikes again, out of nowhere. Length ball outside off, Pujara hangs his bat out, the ball moves just a little bit maybe to take the outside edge, goes low to du Plessis' left at first slip, around shin height, but he does well to pouch it with both hands
short of length outside off, goes back and cuts it firmly, cannot beat backward point though
length ball outside off, taps it towards covers for a quick single
length ball outside off, comes forward and blocks
beaten! A touch fuller and wider outside off, Kohli leans forward to block but the ball spins just enough to beat the bat
a touch fuller outside off, a big forward stride to smother it
fuller around off, blocked from the front foot once again
a bouncer around off stump, Agarwal ducks under it without much fuss
length ball at the batsman, rising towards the rib cage, Agarwal dabs it in front of square leg
length ball outside off, in the corridor, left alone
outside edge but goes between slip and gully. A short of length delivery angling in, Agarwal was looking to play on the leg side, gets square up but there is no second slip
short of length around off, Agarwal gets on his toes and defends it down
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and drives it firmly, extra cover makes the stop
tossed up outside off and drawing him lunging forward but the ball spins past the bat
length ball and this time Kohli goes deep in his crease and clips it off his pads to square leg
extra bounce from that length ball but he rides the bounce and cuts to backward point
a bit quicker, goes well back and jabs it in defence
good length outside off, he takes a big stride out to smother it
fuller on the stumps, well forward to defend it again
length outside off, pushed to cover on the front foot
bit of a wobble in the air, but a touch too full, and driven firmly to cover
keeps it very full again, and driven to mid-off
back of a length in the channel, tried to steer it away with a horizontal bat but only chops it down towards the slip fielder
he's keeping to a very tight line is Philander, just on that fourth stump. Subtle movement away again, but defended towards gully
swings into him but the line goes awray, on the pads, wristed to mid-on
good length, drawing him well on the front foot to defend on off stump
big stride out to smother the ball again on off
too full and Kohli clips it on his front foot to mid-on's right but Muthuswamy dives and stops the ball well
good length, he was caught on the crease a bit, but read the line well and punches to cover

over the top and into the stands. Excellent use of the feet, skipped down the track on twinkling feet, had to stretch a bit for it with the Maharaj bowling it wide, but got excellent timing on it and lifted it straight back over the bowler's head

action replay! Just a might straighter and with more power. This is dismissive of the bowler and Agarwal has got to 99 in some style. Down the track again and powers this straight over the sightscreen this time.
length around off, blocked
too straight and flicked off his pads to deep square leg
back of a length but down leg, a one-day wide that was. Agarwal tried to glance it fine but doesn't connect and good take by Quinton

steered past the lone slip and into the boundary for another Test match hundred. Back of a length outside off, he had a bit of a flash at it almost, going with only hands - as he has done in the innings - but controlled it well and sent it to the third man boundary.
wide of off again, flashes it through cover
length on the stumps, pushed to mid-on
floated up outside off, he goes well back and cuts to point's right
flatter on a length, comes forward to defend

driven firmly back but was that a chance? Ooh yes, went low to his left and he had to get down in a hurry on his follow through, got only fingertips to it. This was a little wider of off and Kohli wanted to drive it down the ground powerfully, but got the toe-end
length on the stumps, defended
good length, he has to lunge out and defend outside off
good length again, this time on a middle stump line, stretches forward and defends with the full face
length ball in the channel, defended from the crease, drops the ball down near his feet
good length on the fourth stump line, Kohli thrusts forward to meet the ball as is his wont, and pushes to cover
length ball on off stump, defended towards point
back of a length outside off, rocks back to cut it but it doesn't bounce as much as he expects and it bangs into the ground in front of him off an under-edge
back of a length but on a sixth stump line that time and safely left alone

length ball nibbling around off and coming back a touch. Perhaps that was the plan - drag Kohli across and nip it back in. He did that in Cape Town in 2018. But this is Pune and the ball doesn't really come back enough, gets a thick inside edge off Kohli's forward prod and rolls towards mid-on
comes on the front foot to defend but it spins a tad more than he budgeted for and takes a thick outside edge past slip
good length, Kohli comes well forward to defend
drags it slightly short and Kohli makes use of the depth of the crease to rock back and create more space and cut fiercely through point. There is little margin for error for Maharaj
tossed up, blocked
good length, he goes deep in his crease again and wants to whip it, but doesn't time it well
too short again and he goes back to whip through the legside, but the ball pings into the short leg fielder
length on off, gets behind it and defends
short outside off but also wide and Agarwal stretches out and guides it through point
back of a length on off, defended from the crease
some zip on that, on a length and seaming into him, but he lets it go and it goes well clear of the stumps
full on off, driven from the crease to cover

and that's a third for Rabada Why did Faf wait so long to bring back after lunch? He's held on to another good catch in the slips though. Rabada's got the in-form batsman. Kicked off a length and Agarwal was looking push it but ends up getting an edge that du Plessis holds on to while tumbling across to his left
length outside off, steered towards point on the front foot
tossed up nicely and gets a bit of dip on this too, but well outside off and spinning away, so Kohli able to shoulder arms easily
fuller on middle and leg, nudged off the front foot to mid-on
flatter, goes well back and jabs it out
big stride out again to block
short ball first up outside off, Rahane sways away
length ball outside off, kicks a bit and is defended into the offside
he's feeling the rhythm now Rabada, gets another one to go past Rahane, back of a length outside off. That seemed to zip through quicker
length on the stumps, defended into the leg side
Fullish outside off, defended to cover by getting to the pitch of the ball
goes to pull this short ball but is late on it and it hits him just below the grille and falls to the ground
length outside off, defended on the front foot
too short and he rocks back to whack this through midwicket but can't time it well and it rolls off the bottom half of the bat
fuller, defended
length, goes back in his crease and flicks it off his pads, but can't go past the short leg
good length on the stumps, lunges forward to defend
tossed up outside off, he stays beside it and opens the face with a big stride out to guide it to point's right
length outside off, seaming in a touch but safely left alone
length ball in the channel, steered to gully
suprise yorker and Kohli got his bat down in time to keep it out. Was right on off stump and Kohli was rooted to the crease, but did well to get bat on it
back of a length into the body, Kohli moving inside the line and jabs it down into the legside
fuller on the stumps, driven gently past the bowler to mid-off
back of a length outside off, stabbed towards cover
tossed up on the stumps, takes a half step forward and drives it back to the bowler
good length and gets some bite off the pitch with turn and bounce, Kohli goes well back and pats it down to short fine leg
length outside off, big stride out to defend

overthrows go for four This was a good ball again but Kohli negotiated it into the point area by staying beside it and steering it. They were going for a quick single and there was a wild throw by Rabada - of all people - swooping in from point and throwing off balance. Into the square leg fence
tossed up on off, defended
good length outside off again and Rahane stretches out and pushes it into the offside
back of a length outside off, defended from the crease to the bowler's left
length outside off, jabbed to point

just clears de Kock. The bouncer was always coming and Kohli seemed to have decided to take it on. Was moving inside the line to hook but gets a glove on it. De Kock leaps to his left with glove outstretched but it just eludes him
151 kph. back of a length outside off defended while rising up on his toes
digs it into the pitch and around off, Kohli hops and pats it down from near waist height to the bowler's right
another pacy back of length ball outside off and pushed from the crease in defence
tossed up on leg and gets some turn, Rahane goes back and across and taps it into the leg side
angles it on the leg stump and Rahane stretches forward to defend, gets inside edge onto pad
fuller on the stumps, driven back
good length, he opts to stay back and pushes it tentatively towards gully
length on off and he stays deep in his crease, trying to play it late and defends it into the offside
yorker length almost on the stumps, driven to cover

this time he gets on top of the bounce nicely and pulls it to mid-on's right and into the boundary. Fetched that pull from outside off and over his shoulder, but this was just 136 kph from Nortje, so Kohli had more time
quicker one this time, and he gets a bit of a leading edge trying to clip it. The ball doesn't hang in the air too long though
148.1 kph, but very full on off, he goes across and clips it off his pads to backward square leg
was that a yorker gone wrong? Ends up as a half volley on the pads and Rahane flicks it effortlessly through midwicket to get off the mark after a nervy start
length on leg stump, clipped again, but this time straight to mid on
short ball, he's late on the pull and it goes off the toe end. Rolls gently towards mid-on and Rahane realises there's a run there for the taking, and calls Kohli through
fuller, stretches out to defend
angles it into him and ends up on the leg stump, he tries to nudge it into the legside but it takes the outside edge and rolls to silly point's left
length outside off, defended
tossed up on the stumps, lunges forward and defends with the full face
tossed up on the fourth stump, big stride out to defend again
drags it short, he rocks back  and punches powerfully but can't go past cover
back of a length outside off, Kohli gets behind it and defends
length on the sixth stump, defended towards point
back of a length outside off again, pushed into the offside
back of a length on a fifth stump line, lets it go through
digs it in short that time but well outside off so Kohli can sway away easily. De Kock has to leap up to gather the ball and that stung a bit. 144 kph - and a bouncer at that speed is seriously quick
and he's caught Kohli in two minds there with a 148 kph ball in the channel. Kohli thinks about leaving it rather late, trying to get bat out of the way, and it clips the bat and bounces to slip
fullish length on the stumps, gently defended on the front foot
good length but he went right back to it, some turn again for Maharaj and Rahane defends with soft hands, almost tentatively
goes back and across and pushes it into the offside
length on the stumps, stays beside it and steers it into the offside
fuller on the stumps, lunges forward and defends
tossed up outside off, and Rahane defends on the front foot again
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
fuller around off, Kohli lunges forward and looks to push at it, gets beaten though. de Kock fails to collect cleanly
fuller around off, lunges forward and blocks
pitched up on the stumps, drives it towards long-off
length ball on the stumps, looks to stump, gets an inside edge towards square leg
once again defending outside the line, the ball hits the inner half and goes towards the leg side
length outside off, stays back and drops it towards point, looks to sneak in a single but Rahane sends him back
fuller on the stumps, drives it back towards the bowler
length ball on the stumps, goes back and turns it towards square leg
length ball on the stumps, comes forward and dead-bats it
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and blocks again
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and defends once more
length ball around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball around off, goes deep and turns it towards square leg for a quick single
fuller on the stumps, gets forward and smothers it
oversteps this time, a big no-ball. Fuller around off, defended
slower through the air, length ball outside off, opens the face to work it towards short third man
fuller on the stumps, defended off the front foot
comes forward and takes on the full, pushed towards mid-on
fuller on the stumps, comes forward and defends with bat and pad together
short of the length, some room outside off as well, rocks back and cuts it past point for four
too full this time, digs it out towards the squarer short cover
fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
pitched up on the stumps, Kohli brings his wrists into play this time and whips it past the mid-on fielder, second boundary of the over
fuller outside off, driven towards cover, Bavuma throws himself to his left but can make only a partial stop
fuller on the stumps, driven towards long-off from the front foot
length ball outside off, Rahane defends it on the off side, with the turn
short of length outside off, goes for the cut but fails to middle it, ends up slicing it towards short third man, was in the air but well away from the fielder and beats him to the fence
another no-ball, fuller around off, defended
length ball on the stumps, goes back and defends it towards the leg side with a straight bat
short of length outside off, punched towards backward point
length ball outside off, Rahane lets it go through, doesn't turn though and goes straight, wasn't too far from the off stump
starts with a half-tracker outside off, Kohli goes back and pulls it through midwicket, beating the man in the deep
length ball outside off, taps it towards cover-point
length outside off, cuts it into the ground, dribbles towards covers
fuller around off, comes forward and pushes it towards cover
pitched up once again, driven firmly towards long-off for a walking single
fuller and wider this time, Rahane gently places it towards deep extra cover
length ball on the stumps, goes back and turns it towards square leg
fuller on the stumps, defends with a big stride forward
length ball around off, comes forward and defends it
pitched up around off and middle, smothered under his eyes
fuller again, around middle and off, dead-batted again
full outside off, comes forward and offer another block
fuller outside off, drives it through extra cover for a couple
too full outside off, digs it out towards deep point
fuller outside off, pushed towards extra cover gently
length outside off, goes back and punches it towards deep point, they get two before sweeper cover comes across, this stand is worth 51 now
length ball on the stumps, played back towards the bowler
flatter and quicker outside off, goes back and blocks
and a huge appeal from the bowler. Mainly by the bowler. Was a length ball outside off, nips back to beat the bat, hits him high on the back thigh. And replays show there was an edge as well
length ball outside off, comes forward and defends, not from the middle of the bat though as the ball dribbles towards short midwicket
fuller on the stumps, and Kohli flicks it away in front of square leg, easy pickings for Kohli
fuller around off, flicked again but straight towards mid-on this time
fuller outside off, leans into the cover drive, Bavuma with the chase but the ball beats him, and that's fifty for Kohli
length outside off, moving away after pitching, left alone
length ball outside off, nips back in, beats the bat and hits the bat high on the thigh
short of length around off, an inside edge on to the back thigh and it drops on the off side, Kohli spots the opportunities and hares to the other end
length ball but angling down the leg side, Kohli cannot connect the flick
fuller but way outside off, left alone
length ball outside off, around fifth stump and moving away off the seam, shouldered arms again
length in the channel, but once again Kohli is not interested
length ball around off, a hint of away-movement, comes forward and blocks
length outside off, around fourth stump maybe, at 121.9kph. And it wasn't a slower one. Defended from the front foot
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg
length outside off, Kohli was in two minds there, looks to defend first before pulling his bat out. The ball hits the face of the bat and runs between second slip and gully
fuller outside off, leans into the drive but Bavuma makes a diving stop at extra cover, deflects it towards mid-off
fuller outside off, in the channel and leaving the batsman after landing, left alone
short of length outside off, gets on his toes and works it square of the wicket on the off side
a touch fuller around off, comes forward and blocks
length ball around off, stays back and defends it behind the wicket with soft hands
fuller, around fifth stump, Rahane comes forward, was looking to play at it first but pulls out at the last moment
length ball on the pads, tucked away towards square leg, a loud no from Rahane
short of length angling in towards the batsman, looks to defend on the leg side, the ball hits the outer half of the bat and drops towards the off side
length ball around off, stays back and defends it towards short midwicket
fuller and wider outside off, swinging away further, left alone
great placement, fuller again but much closer to Kohli this time, who gets forward and drives it past the diving extra cover on his right, mid-off had no chance either and dives in vain
length ball outside off, around fifth stump, Kohli pushes at it with hands and gets beaten as the ball moves away
fuller around off and middle, comes on the front foot and defends it towards mid-on
in the channel but too full, Kohli leaves it alone
short from Rabada, right at the batsman. Rahane goes for the pull but is late on the shot, just manages it get it past the keeper
hits the good length straightaway and brings the ball in, nearly an appeal as an inside edge saved Rahane from being trapped
beats the outside edge. A touch shorter outside off, the ball holds its line and Rahane is caught poking on the back foot
solid defence this time with the ball closer to the off stump on length, Rahane blocks
right on the off stump this time on good length, good bounce, and Rahane hangs back to defend it back
errs down the leg side past the pads, and it's called a no ball for overstepping
136.5kmh, on length again outside off, Rahane watches it carefully and defends it into the off side
inside edge straightway from Kohli has the South Africans 'oooh'ing as Kohli poked in front of his body for the incoming length delivery and got a single towards square leg
on length outside off, no movement, and it's left alone easily
keeps a tad low on the off stump, it went straight after pitching around length and Rahane blocked it back
really good carry this time towards de Kock's shoulders. Much wider outside off and easy to leave for Rahane
128.3kmh, not much pace or movement to beat him outside off, Rahane waits and defends the ball towards point
swings this one away with that tempting drivable length outside off, but it wasn't that close to off and Rahane left it again with a forward lean
137.4kmh, in the corridor outside off, not much movement and left alone
good bounce again to reach above de Kock's shoulders as it's well outside off to be left again
good bounce again outside off, not so close to off and Kohli shoulders arms again
again well outside off, shapes it away nicely and Kohli lets it go
much straighter this time and it's right on the stumps, much fuller too, and Kohli drives it down nicely for a single
slightly full just outside off, Rahane barely moves his feet and pushes this into the covers
tight line on off stump but it's only 123.4kmh, Kohli defends it back
120.6kmh, wider outside off on length, good carry but the line makes Kohli shoulder his arms
beats him outside off! Excellent delivery there. He brought the length shorter, pitched it just around off, it seamed away with good bounce and beat the bat by a distance
gets bat on it but he nearly withdraw it as the ball shaped away again after pitching on that good length again around off. It's the movement that's troubling Kohli
leaves it alone this time as the length goes a bit wider with the away movement

edged between de Kock and first slip for four! Excellent over from Philander, drawing the outside edge finally this time with the away movement from length, Kohli poked and got the outside edge and replays confirm the ball had carried, but it landed right in between de Kock and first slip. And replays confirm the ball had just about carried to de Kock, but it snuck under his right glove as he went for the dive. It was nowhere close to first slip
on length outside off, pushed into he covers tentatively
short of length this time outside off and it's punched to point
touch fuller outside off, Rahane doesn't move his feet much and pushes this into the covers
goes towards the leg stump now and Rahane helps the ball towards square leg off the hips
pretty straight outside off on length, good carry and Kohli shoulders arms
full, just outside off, and nice carry through to the keeper. Left alone by Rahane
full, outside off stump once again. Rahane gets to the pitch of the ball before shouldering his arms
full, outside off stump. In that nagging channel, and left alone once again
shortens his length this time. Outside off stump, and Rahane covers his stumps before shouldering his arms
length ball just outside off. Seam movement away after hitting the deck. Shoulders his arms
length ball, outside off, and this time Rahane gets bat on ball. Punched off the back foot to cover
good length, just outside off stump. Kohli rides the bounce and fends it away to cover point
full, outside off, and wild away movement after hitting the seam. Kohli lets it go
length ball outside off stump. He covers his stumps before shouldering his arms
full, just outside off, and Kohli prods forward to drive. Finds cover though
full, on middle stump. Looks to flick leg-side but hits it back to the bowler instead
sublime! Full, on middle, and he settles onto the front foot before driving past the umpire to the long-on boundary
through the slip cordon! Full, just outside off, and he comes forward to drive. Takes an outside edge, and goes through the gap between second and a wide-ish third slip
good length on middle, and guided off his pads to square leg for a single
full, just outside off, and he prods forward to check-drive. Plays with soft hands as the ball flies away to point after hitting the blade
full, just outside off stump. Defended with the bat's open face towards point
full, wide-ish outside off, and he leans into a drive. Mistimed to cover
length ball, outside off, and he walks towards the ball's line before fending off the back foot
back of a length, outside off stump. He tiptoes to cut this from the top of the ball but misses altogether
length ball, just outside off stump. Punched with the bat's open face to point
full, just outside off stump. Prods forward to defend, but his soft hands ensure the edge falls short of du Plessis at second slip
exquisite! Back of a length on off, but not bouncing enough to trouble Kohli. Swivels and places a pull in front of square, past mid-on's right for four
full, just outside off stump. Through to the keeper as Kohli shoulders his arms
good length, outside off stump. Left alone. True carry through to the keeper
good length on off stump. Defended off the back foot
fuller, just outside off stump. Minimal footwork, but defended towards cover. Loud shout of 'no' for the single
full, just outside off stump. Defended away with the bat's open face to point
length ball, on off stump. He covers his off stump and defends it away to point
full, on off stump. Defended away to cover
full, just outside off stump. A bit of swing into the batsman, and tapped away to cover
length ball, just outside off. Too close to his body for the cut, and therefore the shot carries nearly to Markram at second slip
back of a length, outside off stump, and punched to cover
full, outside off stump. Too late into the drive. Mistimed to Elgar at cover point
length ball, on off stump. He covers his off stump before fending off the back foot
full, on off stump. Angling into him, and guided away to the leg side for a quick single. That's the hundred partnership
full, just outside off stump. Defended away to point
wayward delivery. Full on middle and angling down leg. Kohli pounces on it, using his wrists to flick a boundary past the square leg umpire. Nigel Llong had to do a jig to avoid the ball
full, just outside off, and left alone
full, just outside off, and he leans into a drive. Elgar, at mid-off, dives to his left to stop the ball. Rabada's fifth no-ball
length ball, outside off stump. Tries to cut, but under-edged onto his pads
length ball on off, and angling into his body. Turned off his hips to the leg side
length ball just outside off stump. The attempted defensive shot is inside edged onto his pads again
full, on leg stump, and comfortably flicked off his pads past the square-leg umpire for the over's second boundary
full, just outside off, and he leans into a front-foot drive. Muthusamy does well at mid off to get his body behind the ball. Stops a certain boundary
length ball, outside off stump. He rides the bounce and crunches a beautiful square cut past point for four
length ball, just outside off, and check punched to cover

sharp delivery! Nortje gives Rahane a stare thereafter that gets the crowd going. Length ball just outside off but the ball takes some extra bounce after hitting the deck. Whizzing past Rahane's outside edge on this occasion
back of a length, effort ball outside off but Rahane drags a pull to deep backward square leg
full, just outside off stump. Gets behind the line of the ball and defended
back of a length, outside off stump. Cut square but finds point
god length, just outside off stump. He covers his line and blocks off the back foot
length ball, on off stump. Blocked off the back foot to the cover region
full, just outside off stump. Defended
length ball, outside off stump, and defended off the back foot to cover point
length ball on middle stump. Defended off the back foot to mid on.
back of a length outside off, good carry, he leaves it alone
length on off stump, defended towards cover

kept a bit low, back of a length on the fifth stump line, Kohli wanted to push at it, but he's playing well away from the body. Uncharacteristic shot for him batting on 80-odd. Goes between bat and yawning gap with body
length outside off, steered between cover and point by opening the face of the bat
cracking shot. Back of a length outside off, he got into position beautifully, perfect weight transfer on the back foot and cuts it to deep point's left
fuller outside off, he takes a step forward and gets close to the pitch of the ball to drive through cover. Looking a lot more fluent suddenly, is Rahane

oh that's a mighty close shout Not given perhaps because the umpire thought it pitched outside leg? But hit him dead in front. And Faf has gone for the review, so DRS is clearly working again. and it's pitched outside leg clearly, so that will be not out. Got this to break sharply from a length and struck Rahane right in front though
fuller on the stumps, front foot defence
full on middle and leg, takes a big stride forward to smother it
good length, drawing him on the front foot and gets this one to dip a bit too, but Rahane has lunged far enough to defend comfortably in the end
length on the stumps, patted down and short leg fields
given room outside off, cuts it but straight to point

edged past second slip. Kohli has edged a few in this innings, but all with soft hands. He pushes at this length ball outside off, which kicks a bit more and takes the shoulder of the bat to go past a despairing second slip dive
length outside off, pushed to cover's left
good length on off, gets behind the line to defend
fuller on off, solidly blocked back to the bowler
length on the stumps, goes back and across to tuck this to midwicket
yorker on middle stump, but Kohli gets bat down in time to jam it back to the bowler
nice length and line on the stumps, he comes on the front foot to defend
down the track, but doesn't get hold of it. Wanted to thump it down the ground, but gets a thick inside edge that rolls to midwicket's left, whose dive slows the ball up and mid-on collects
nicely tossed up on the stumps, Kohli makes some room to off-drive but the short extra cover in place fields it
fuller on off, defended towards cover
tossed up full on off, driven to long-off
full on the stumps, gently turned of his toes to midwicket
back of a length and good carry outside off, he rises on his toes with the ball and punches through cover
length, angling into him ends up on middle and leg, pushed back to the bowler's right
length, homing in on off stump, but he defends comfortably from the crease
digs it in short but Rahane got into position early, rocked back and pulled this from in front of his face, kept it down. Square leg is deep though and is able to collect
length outside off, gets to the pitch of it with front foot coming nicely forward to defend
length outside off, tapped softly towards cover and he wants a single but is sent back
strays on the pads and too full, flicked away but midwicket dives to his left to stop it
tossed up on the stumps, defended on the front foot
length on middle and leg, tapped into the legside
goes back and makes some room to cut this from outside off, but it's to point
drags it shorter and Rahane is waiting for it, transfers weight back and cuts it firmly and very square. Cover thinks he has a chance of running back and pulling it in, but the ball wins the race
tossed up fuller, overcompensates, and is flicked off his toes to mid-on's right
back of a length outside off, nudged through midwicket for a quick single and raises a battling fifty. He was patient, took his time, and has capitalised
fuller length outside off, he goes across to flick this to the legside but doesn't time it well. Ball rolls to mid-on off the inside half of the bat
length outside off, seaming in a touch, left well alone
good length outside off, solid front foot defence
fuller length on off, punched firmly on the front foot, but straight to cover
back of a length and room outside off, punched through cover this time to pick up the single
tossed up around off, defended with a big stride out
fuller on the stumps, walks into the flick but can't beat mid-on
gripped a bit on the pitch and turned, snakes under Kohli's bat as he attempts a steer away
fuller, flicked to mid-on's right
fuller, driven towards mid-off
slightly back of a length and he goes deep in his crease to create more room to cut, but only chops it towards gully
fuller outside off, guides it to point by opening the face of the bat
good length, makes him stretch forward to defend towards point
too short but Kohli unable to slap it away, mis-times it and it rolls to mid-on
length outside off, stays beside it and punches through point
length outside off, comes on the front foot to defend
floated up on a length again, but Rahane happy to get forward and smother it
back of a length outside off, pushed to extra cover
kicks off from a length outside off but Kohli was not going to play at that and de Kock collects
length outside off, pushes forward to defend

magnificent straight drive to bring up his first Test century of 2019. It was an anomaly that had to be corrected, and Kohli's done it in style. Half volley on leg stump but it still had to be put away and he punched it straight down the ground, lovely full face of the bat shown.
length outside off, left alone
fuller on off, steered to point on the front foot
goes back in his crease to whip this to midwicket
full on the stumps, defended on the front foot
too full and down leg, he brings out the paddle sweep and plays it fine enough to pick up two
tossed up outside off, lunges out to block it
length outside off, defended on the front foot
good length on the stumps and gently turning away but Rahane takes a big stretch forward to block it
length outside off, pushed back to the bowler
length outside off, defended to cover
fuller but on leg stump and he comes on the front foot to clip this to mid-on's right
length on off, defended back to the bowler
length outside off, defended to cover
back of a length nibbling around off, defended from the crease
given some air on the stumps, forward defensive
length on the stumps, goes deep and flicks between midwicket and mid-on
fuller on the stumps, steps forward and clips it to the bowler
slightly short, and he goes back to whip this off his pads through midwicket
fuller on the stumps, big stride out to defend
defended on the back foot to cover
way outside off , tossed up a lot and left alone
gets the line closer to the stumps that time but Rahane comes on the front foot to stroke it through cover
floated up outside off again, gets some turn but enough time for Rahane to rock back and cut it. Point dives and saves

risky single. There was no need for that, and Rahane would have been mighty upset with Kohli for calling him through. This was floated outside off and Kohli pushed it to cover and called for a single. There was none actually and Bavuma was the fielder, who swooped in and fired the throw back. Direct hit would have run Rahane out
goes on the back foot this time and pats it back to the bowler
fuller on off and he defends on the front foot
full outside off, and turning further away. Left alone
full, on leg stump. Tapped back to Muthusamy
length ball on off and skidding through. Fended off the back foot
length ball on middle. Tapped off the back foot behind square for a single
full delivery, outside off stump. Fended away to cover point
full, on his toes, and flicked straight to midwicket. A couple of feet on either side of the fielder and that would've been a boundary
glorious! Full, on middle stump, and he leans forward to drive straight past the bowler
good length, just outside off stump. Defended off the back foot
full, on middle, and punched with the full face of the bat. Past Rahane this time, and another boundary to the long-on fence
good length, just outside off stump. Fended off the back foot
length ball, outside off stump. Kohli toe-ends a punch back to the bowler
overpitched on off, and the attempted whip is toe-ended to midwicket
length ball on off, and angling into the stumps. Makes room to cut square
length ball outside off. Extra bounce surprises Rahane, but he manages to cut a shot along the ground anyway
full and wide. Virat rocks back to cut, but finds Rabada standing at point
length ball on leg stump. He rocks back and whips a shot along the ground to deep backward square leg. He's overstepped though
full, on leg stump. Worked off his toes to the leg side
full, just outside off stump. Defended with soft hands
length ball on off, and he rides the bounce before defending off the back foot
full outside off, and he caresses a drive through the off side! Du Plessis' chase is futile
back of a length, on off stump. He rides the bounce and firmly punches towards cover
length ball on off stump. Fended off the back foot to mid-on
length ball, just outside off stump. Fended off the back foot to cover
length ball angling into his chest. Guided off the back foot to deep midwicket. Fielder in the deep nearly costs South Africa overthrows
full, just outside off stump. Defended away to cover

that's Maharaj's 100th wicket! Floating delivery outside off, and spinning slightly away. Rahane comes forward to defend, but it takes a feather-touch off his glove bat and the keeper holds on. Umpire Llong raised his finger pretty late, but his decision was made easy by Rahane's decision to walk
length ball, outside off and turning into the left-hander from around the wicket. Flicked to deep midwicket
full on off stump. Defended to short cover
full toss on leg, and whipped through the leg side. Fielder at mid wicket gives it a mighty chase
full, outside off stump and turning into him. Defended with a big stride forward
length ball outside off stump. Punched to cover
length ball outside off, and Kohli looks to shoulder his arms. Ball takes the toe-end of his bat before falling just short of the diving de Kock. Kohli was out had that carried
length ball, angling into him. Whipped behind square to deep backward square
full on off stump. Defended towards point
back of a length on middle stump. He rides the bounce before fending it away
length ball outside off, and angling further away. Left alone
length ball outside off, and he looks to whip it towards midwicket. But the ball stays low and mistimes it instead
full, outside off, and driven with the turn to cover
slower through the air. Full, outside off, and defended towards cover
length ball on off. Gets behind the ball and punches to midwicket
full on off, and slapped back straight. Maharaj can't get fingertips to it as it rattles into the bowler's stumps
full, just outside off. Pierces the gap on the off side but can't beat the infield
back of a length on middle, and angling further away. Left alone
full, on off stump. Tapped back to the bowler
back of a length on off, and tapped to point for a quick single
full outside off, and the delivery seams away after hitting the deck. Kohli goes fishing outside off stump but - lucky for him - it makes no contact with the bat
full, on off, and he leans into a straight drive. Finds mid-on though

appeal but Kohli stays his ground! Fullish on off and Kohli tries to flick leg-side, but it hits something before going through to the keeper. Not sure whether appeal was for caught behind or lbw - the latter would've definitely been not out since the ball hit the flap of his pad which effectively means 'too high'
full outside off, and Jadeja looks to pad it away. Goes over his pads to the keeper
full, on off and turning in. Defended with soft hands
full, outside off, and driven past short midwicket to long on
full, outside off stump. Tries to whip a straight drive, but toe-ends it to mid-on instead
full, just outside off stump. Driven back to the bowler
length ball, outside off stump. Guided to point
full, from around the wicket. Lands on off stump, and defended to Rabada. Wayward throw from the fielder - towards the keeper - allows india to pinch a single. Rabada isn't happy with QdK's effort
full, outside off, and defended with soft hands
full, on middle, and flicked through midwicket. Maharaj - in the deep - has no chance
back of a length on middle. Angling down leg, and he mistimes a pull down to fine leg for a single
length ball, just outside off, and whizzing past his outside edge to the keeper
length ball, just outside off stump. Fended away off the back foot
length ball on off. Flicked to square leg for a single
full, just outside off stump. Defended
full, outside off stump. Slaps a drive to mid-off
full on middle stump. Whipped to mid-off, where Philander's misfield allows Kohli to take the second run
full outside off stump. Driven with the bat's open face to extra cover
back of a length on off, and he mistimes an attempted pull to wide long on
length ball, outside off stump. He shoulders his arms
full, just outside off stump. Drilled through the covers for an exquisite boundary. Rabada's sixth over in this spell has been a lil wayward
full, just outside off stump. Defended towards mid-off
pacey! Full, outside off stump and through to the keeper with Kohli sticking his bat outside off stump
length ball on off, and tapped into the gap on the off side for a sprint of a single
length ball on off, and fended off the back foot
flies over first slip! Length ball on off, and he looks to cut, but can only edge it over Faf du Plessis. Fielder was surprised by the pace the ball generated off the bat
full, just outside off stump. Defended towards cover point
good length on middle. Worked off his pads to the leg side
full outside off, and he whips a shot to Philander at mid-on. Apologises after a wayward throw to the bowler

edged past Faf again! Full outside off, and turning away. Kohli tries to drill a drive through the covers but the turn finds his outside edge. Faf too slow to react to a difficult catch and that's 150 for the India captain as the ball rolls away to the third-man fence
length ball on middle. Angling across Jadeja and fended towards cover
length ball on leg stump. Clipped off his hips to deep backward square leg
full, just outside off stump. Defended off the front foot
full, just outside off. Firmly driven to mid-off
length ball on off, and fended towards cover for a quick single. Bavuma runs in, collects the ball, and throws down the stumps, but Jadeja is lightning fast too
back of a length on middle, and blocked off the back foot
length ball, outside off stump. Cut to point
full on off, and driven with the turn
edged past Faf du Plessis again! Full outside off, and the attempted drive is edged past the slip fielder's right for four more
full, outside off, and drilled back to KM
length ball, outside off, defended
full outside off, and driven to short cover
length ball, keeps it straight on the stumps, defended from the crease but a little tentative push at it, and it goes on to pad off the inside edge
length going slightly across, pushed to cover. They look for the single but there isn't one there
good length, defended
bouncer, and he ducks under it quickly. Bit of heat possibly in the middle with some words exchanged between bowler and batsman
back of a length on the stumps, gets behind the line and defends
short of a length on leg stump, Jadeja was attempting to leave it, but it flicks the thigh pad and runs down to the boundary. No runs because no shot played
fuller on the stumps, driven inside out to cover
fuller outside off, worked back to the bowler
good length, Jadeja gets a huge lunge out to smother it, doesn't quite get to the pitch and it loops up off pad near where short leg would have been
fuller, defended again
length outside off, padded away towards slip
fuller outside off, nice stride forward to defend
length outside off, steered to point
length outside off, defended
fuller on off, forceful drive on the front foot but picks out cover
nicely done by Kohli, controlled pull shot to fine leg. Spotted the short ball early, moved inside the line and just rolled his wrists over it to keep it down
length on the stumps, moves across and tucks it in front of square with soft hands - giving them enough time to take two even as the man from deep square leg has to run in and gather
length outside off, punched to cover
length outside off, opens the face to steer it towards point and they take a quick single
too short and well outside off, flayed through point with a horizontal bat
fuller outside off, makes Kohli stretch out to defend
keeps it full but slightly wider outside off and Kohli deftly opens the face of his bat to run it through point
length around off, defended on the front foot
length but too straight and spinning into him, he goes back and flicks this off his pads to short fine leg's right
angling into him on a length, defended from the crease
oooh that was close to off stump, but ends up being a good leave by Jadeja. Coming in with the angle on a length
length ball into him, ends up on the pads, turned away but straight to midwicket
back of a length on off, pushed to cover
back of a length and kicked off from outside off, de Kock collects it near his face after Jadeja lets it go
length on off, defended towards mid-on
goes well back to this fullish ball on off, turning away and plays with the angle to push it towards point
drags it shorter and Kohli is quick to transfer weight back and cut this through backward point
length but well outside off, he lets it go
fuller outside off, steps forward and clips it back to the bowler
length outside off, comes forward to get to the pitch and smother the spin
fuller outside off, worked off his front foot to midwicket. Played softly and they have enough time to get back for a second
fuller outside off and he unfurls a smooth cover drive, getting to the pitch with a step forward. There is a sweeper back there so it doesn't go all the way
length outside off, steered to point
fullish, homing in on the offstump, but Kohli manoeuvres it skilfully into the cover-point region
another brave leave by Jadeja to a length ball on the fourth stump, especially given the round the wicket angle. That was close to off stump, but eventually the batsman's safe
length ball on the stumps, going across, and he pushes it to cover. Starts to look for a run and has to do a bit of a ballet to avoid stepping on the danger area
length on off, pushed towards cover again, no run
short and wide outside off, Kohli looked like he wanted to step out, but stayed in his crease and slashed it to point
flatter on the stumps, pushed to mid-on

tossed up outside off and he stretches out to cream this through the covers and into the boundary. Good confident shot. Maharaj has been bowling to that line against Jadeja but once he erred, Jadeja took full toll

that's stunning timing. Maharaj pulls his length back and Jadeja goes deep inside his crease to whip it through midwicket. Looked like a shot that would fetch one or two runs at most, instead it goes all the way
tapped round the corner to fine leg
leathered an off-drive that just eludes short extra cover. Steps out to get to the pitch and smashes this powerfully. wasn't really a catching chance for the fielder

Kohli's looking to hit out now perhaps. Comes on the front foot and smashes this past Philander. Not great timing but enough meat to race to the boundary. That takes Kohli past Smith's career Test runs tally
fuller outside off, flayed to the man at deep extra cover
back of a length outside off, punched through point
fuller on the pads, flicked languidly through midwicket
length on the stumps, mis-times it to mid-on
length on the stumps, wristed to midwicket and Kohli is absolutely haring down the pitch to steal that single and keep strike. Jadeja responds a mite late, but is quick enough to make it
too short, rocks back and pulls but short midwicket fields
back of a length outside off, steers it fine but Faf at slip dives to his right to stop the ball
creates room by going deep in his crease and rocks back to pull this to the deep midwicket boundary. Had to manufacture all the pace on it and did it well enough
too full now and Kohli unleashes a flat-batted slap that Maharaj gets his left hand to, and prevents it going into the straight boundary
dismissive. This is just contempt for the bowler - who must be tiring and is into his 44th over. Slog-swept with disdain to the deep midwicket boundary
back of a length outside off, he stays beside the ball and punch-drives through point. He'll keep strike
length outside off, pushed into the offside for a brisk single

length ball on the stumps, a gentle defensive push by Jadeja to mid-off. He is alive to the possibility of a single and calls Kohli through. They are extremely quick between the wickets and complete it comfortably in the end
length on off, pushed back to the bowler off the inside half of the bat
full outside off and he brings out what has been a productive strike-rotation stroke, the gentle push into the covers and taking off with the momentum of the forward press to complete a quick single
comes in sharply from a length from around the wicket and hits him on the pads. Comfortably going down leg
back of a length, stump to stump, Jadeja stays still and opens the face of the bat to steer it to backward point
full toss on leg stump, he steps forward and flicks to deep square leg
flatter on a good length, he comes on the front foot to defend
length ball around off, comes forward and works it to mid-on
too full and clipped to long-on
tossed up on leg stump, he steps forward and flicks it off his toes almost to deep midwicket
fuller outside off, worked to midwicket
nicely solid forward defensive towards point. Jadeja ambles down the pitch from the non-striker's end but Kohli hasn't moved.
length ball on the stumps and spinning away, but Kohli goes deep in his crease to create the length to punch this down the ground to long-on
tossed up outside off, cuts it through point and they run briskly in the end to complete a second
